column4: Hello , i installed Ubuntu 9.10 on my laptop and when i log in i get msg from Palimpset Disk Utility : SMART status : DISK HAS MANY BAD SECTORS , 1. how can i check how many bad sectors in the disk ? 2. can the bad sectors can be fixed ? 3. can i mark the bad sectors to be unused at all ?
click on the little task tray icon with the warning
or open the "disk" utility in system, administration
oh.. and you might want to backup anything important as soon as possible
